intro: Eupatorium trapezoideum, commonly known as narrowleaf boneset, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Eupatorium trapezoideum is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many familiar flowering plants.
